background: A patient is undergoing radiation treatment with two beams aimed to deliver medicine doses to both a benign area and a tumor, with a goal to minimize radiation received by the pancreas while adhering to maximum and minimum dose limits for the skin and tumor respectively.
constraints: Minutes of Beam 1 used is non-negative
Minutes of Beam 2 used is non-negative
Skin receives at most MaxSkinDose units of medicine from both beams combined
Tumor receives at least MinTumorDose units of medicine from both beams combined
objective: Minimize the total medicine dose received by the pancreas
description: A patient is undergoing radiation treatment involving two beams, Beam 1 and Beam 2. Beam 1 delivers a dose of \param{DosePancreas1} units of medicine per minute to the benign area of the pancreas and \param{DoseSkin1} units of medicine per minute to the benign area of the skin. Beam 2 delivers \param{DosePancreas2} units of medicine per minute to the benign area of the pancreas and \param{DoseSkin2} units of medicine per minute to the benign area of the skin. In addition, beam 1 delivers \param{DoseTumor1} units of medicine per minute to the tumor and beam 2 delivers \param{DoseTumor2} units of medicine per minute to the tumor. At most \param{MaxSkinDose} units of medicine should be received by the skin and at least \param{MinTumorDose} units of medicine should be delivered to the tumor. How many minutes of each beam should be used to minimize the total radiation received by the pancreas?

parameters.definition: Dose of medicine delivered by Beam 1 per minute to the benign area of the pancreas
Dose of medicine delivered by Beam 1 per minute to the benign area of the skin
Dose of medicine delivered by Beam 2 per minute to the benign area of the pancreas
Dose of medicine delivered by Beam 2 per minute to the benign area of the skin
Dose of medicine delivered by Beam 1 per minute to the tumor
Dose of medicine delivered by Beam 2 per minute to the tumor
Maximum units of medicine the skin should receive
Minimum units of medicine the tumor should receive
